name: The Narrows
description: A notorious and densely populated slum area in Gotham City, known for its high crime rate and poverty.

content.title: History
content.body: The Narrows is one of the oldest parts of Gotham City. Over the years, it has become a breeding ground for crime and despair due to neglect and poverty. The area has often been left out of the prosperity and economic development seen in other parts of Gotham, leading to a cycle of crime and poverty.

content.title: Geography
content.body: Located in the heart of Gotham City, The Narrows is characterized by its cramped buildings and narrow, winding streets. It is situated near the water, and its close quarters contribute to the feeling of claustrophobia and neglect.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body: The most infamous location within The Narrows is Arkham Asylum, the city's psychiatric hospital for the criminally insane. This facility plays a significant role in Gotham's history and is a major landmark within The Narrows. The decaying infrastructures and densely packed tenements further depict the areaâ€™s struggle with urban blight.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: In 'Batman Begins', The Narrows serves as a critical location where the film's climax unfolds. It is in The Narrows where Scarecrow and Ra's al Ghul attempt to release a fear-inducing toxin, causing chaos and panic among its residents. The Narrows represents the heart of Gotham's struggle with crime and corruption, symbolizing the city's vulnerabilities and the need for Batman's vigilance.
